```{r, echo=TRUE}
library(dplyr)
library(data.table)


# Connecting with Opal data server
## Login to server and assign study data
#Load Opal R library
library(opalr)
# Create an opal object with the login information
erasmus_opal <- opal.login()
#Login to Opal server and assign the content of the GLOBE table(s) to your RStudio environment
opal.assign.table.tibble(erasmus_opal, 'Tra3_4_Baseline','CLSA_1.Tra3_4_Baseline', variables =list("AGE_NMBR_TRM","SEX_ASK_TRM" , "RET_RTRD_TRM" , "LBF_CURR_TRM", "RET_RTRD_TRM", "LBF_EVER_TRM", "RET_RTRD_TRM","RET_AGE_NB_TRM", "SDC_MRTL_TRM","SN_LIVH_M1_R_TRM",  "SN_LIVH_M2_R_TRM", "SN_LIVH_M3_R_TRM", "SN_LIVH_M4_R_TRM", "SN_LIVH_M5_R_TRM", "SN_LIVH_M6_R_TRM", "SN_LIVH_M7_R_TRM", "SN_LIVH_M8_R_TRM", "SN_LIVH_M9_R_TRM", "SN_LIVH_M10_R_TRM", "SN_LIVH_NB_TRM","SDC_MRTL_TRM", "ED_UDR11_TRM", "SN_LIVHKD_TRM", "LBF_STTS_TRM" ))

CLSA_tra0 <- opal.execute(erasmus_opal,'Tra3_4_Baseline')

opal.assign.table.tibble(erasmus_opal, 'Tra_FU1','CLSA_1.Tra_FU1',  variables=list("AGE_NMBR_TRF1", "SDC_BTHSEX_TRF1", "RET_RTRD_TRF1" , "LBF_CURR_TRF1", "RET_RTRD_TRF1", "LBF_EVER_TRF1", "RET_RTRD_TRF1","RET_AGE_NB_TRF1", "SDC_MRTL_TRF1","SN_LIVH_M1_R_TRF1",  "SN_LIVH_M2_R_TRF1", "SN_LIVH_M3_R_TRF1", "SN_LIVH_M4_R_TRF1", "SN_LIVH_M5_R_TRF1", "SN_LIVH_M6_R_TRF1", "SN_LIVH_M7_R_TRF1", "SN_LIVH_M8_R_TRF1", "SN_LIVH_M9_R_TRF1", "SN_LIVH_M10_R_TRF1", "SN_LIVH_NB_TRF1","SDC_MRTL_TRF1", "RET_RTRN_TRF1", "ED_OTED_TRF1", "LBF_STTS_TRF1"))

#opal.assign.table.tibble(erasmus_opal, 'CoP_FU1','CLSA_tra1.CoP_FU1',  variables=NULL)

CLSA_tra1 <- opal.execute(erasmus_opal,'Tra_FU1')

opal.logout(erasmus_opal)


```
## Assign participant id as first column of your harmonized dataframes
```{r, echo=FALSE}

sdc_CLSA_tra0 <- data.frame(id = CLSA_tra0$id )
sdc_CLSA_tra1 <- data.frame(id = CLSA_tra1$id )

```

### **Variable label**: Age of participant


# Employment and retirement subdomain

### **Variable label**: Employment status   
**Variable name**: sdc_employ_0       
**Variable description**: Indicator of whether the participant is currently in paid employment or is self-employed.    
**Value type**: integer    
**Variable unit**: N/A    
**Category coding**:  

**Code** | **Category Label**  
------------- | -------------  
0 | Currently not in paid employment   
1 | Currently in paid employment

**Harmonization status**:  complete  
**Harmonization comment**:    

**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}

sdc_CLSA_tra0$sdc_employ_0<- ifelse((CLSA_tra0$LBF_CURR_TRM=='1'|CLSA_tra0$LBF_STTS_TRM=='1'|CLSA_tra0$LBF_STTS_TRM=='2'|CLSA_tra0$LBF_STTS_TRM=='3')&(CLSA_tra0$LBF_EVER_TRM!="2"|is.na(CLSA_tra0$LBF_EVER_TRM))&(CLSA_tra0$RET_RTRD_TRM=="3"|CLSA_tra0$RET_RTRD_TRM=="2"),1L,  
                                 ifelse(CLSA_tra0$LBF_CURR_TRM=='2'| 
                                          CLSA_tra0$RET_RTRD_TRM=="1"|CLSA_tra0$RET_RTRD_TRM=="4"|CLSA_tra0$LBF_EVER_TRM=="2", 0L, NA))



table(CLSA_tra0$LBF_CURR_TRM,CLSA_tra0$RET_RTRD_TRM, useNA= "always")
table(CLSA_tra1$LBF_CURR_TRF1,CLSA_tra1$RET_RTRD_TRF1, useNA= "always")
table(CLSA_tra0$LBF_STTS_TRM, CLSA_tra0$RET_RTRD_TRM, useNA="always")

table(sdc_CLSA_tra0$sdc_employ_0, CLSA_tra0$RET_RTRD_TRM, useNA="always")
table(CLSA_tra0$LBF_CURR_TRM, CLSA_tra0$RET_RTRD_TRM, useNA="always")
table(CLSA_tra0$LBF_CURR_TRM, CLSA_tra0$LBF_STTS_TRM, useNA="always")

table(sdc_CLSA_tra0$sdc_employ_0, useNA="always")

```  
### **Variable label**: Employment status   
**Variable name**: sdc_employ_1    
**Variable description**: Indicator of whether the participant is currently in paid employment or is self-employed.    
**Value type**: integer    
**Variable unit**: N/A    
**Category coding**:  

**Code** | **Category Label**  
------------- | -------------  
0 | Currently not in paid employment   
1 | Currently in paid employment  

**Harmonization status**:  complete  
**Harmonization comment**:   Participants who answered as being partly-retired were coded as currently not being in paid employment, since they had missing information on whether they still continue working paid employment. 
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}
table(CLSA_tra1$RET_RTRN_TRF1)
table(CLSA_tra1$RET_RTRD_TRF1)
class(CLSA_tra1$LBF_CURR_TRF1)
table(CLSA_tra1$LBF_STTS_TRF1, CLSA_tra1$LBF_CURR_TRF1, useNA="always")

# sdc_CLSA_tra1$sdc_employ_1 <- ifelse(CLSA_tra1$LBF_CURR_TRF1==2|CLSA_tra1$RET_RTRN_TRF1==2|CLSA_tra1$RET_RTRD_TRF1==1|CLSA_tra1$RET_RTRD_TRF1==4,0L,ifelse(CLSA_tra1$LBF_CURR_TRF1==1,1L, NA))

clsa_table_tra$sdc_employ_1<- ifelse((clsa_table_tra$LBF_CURR_TRF1=='2'|clsa_table_tra$LBF_STTS_TRF1=='2'|clsa_table_tra$LBF_STTS_TRF1=='3'|clsa_table_tra$LBF_STTS_TRF1=='8') & (clsa_table_tra$RET_RTRD_TRF1=="3"|clsa_table_tra$RET_RTRD_TRF1=="2"),1L,
                                 ifelse(clsa_table_tra$LBF_CURR_TRF1=='8'|
                                          clsa_table_tra$RET_RTRD_TRF1=="1", 0L, NA))

clsa_table_tra$sdc_employ_1<- ifelse((clsa_table_tra$RET_RTRD_TRM==1|clsa_table_tra$RET_RTRD_TRM==2) & clsa_table_tra$RET_RTRN_TRF1==2, 0L, clsa_table_tra$sdc_employ_1)
table(clsa_table_tra$sdc_employ_1, useNA="always")
sdc_CLSA_tra1<-merge(sdc_CLSA_tra1,clsa_table[,c("id","sdc_employ_1")],by="id",all.x=TRUE)
table(sdc_CLSA_tra1$sdc_employ_1, useNA="always")

sdc_CLSA_tra1$sdc_employ_1 <- ifelse(CLSA_tra1$LBF_CURR_TRF1==1|CLSA_tra1$RET_RTRD_TRF1==3,1L, ifelse(CLSA_tra1$LBF_CURR_TRF1==2|CLSA_tra1$RET_RTRD_TRF1==1|CLSA_tra1$RET_RTRD_TRF1==4,0L,NA))

table(sdc_CLSA_tra1$sdc_employ_1, useNA="always")

```

### **Variable label**: Retirement status   
**Variable name**: sdc_retire_0     
**Variable description**: Indicator of whether the participant is currently retired.    
**Value type**: integer    
**Variable unit**: N/A    
**Category coding**:  

**Code** | **Category Label**  
------------- | -------------  
0 | Currently not in retirement   
1 | Currently in retirement   

**Harmonization status**:  complete  
**Harmonization comment**:   Study-specific variable is categorized as: Completely retired | Partly retired | Not retired. Completely retired and partly retired people are coded as Currently in retirement. Participants who never held a paid job are coded as Currently not in retirement.  
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}

table(CLSA_tra0$RET_RTRD_TRM,useNA="always")
sdc_CLSA_tra0$sdc_retire_0 <- ifelse(CLSA_tra0$RET_RTRD_TRM==1|CLSA_tra0$RET_RTRD_TRM==2,
                                  1L, ifelse(CLSA_tra0$RET_RTRD_TRM==3|CLSA_tra0$LBF_EVER_TRM==2,0L,NA))

table(sdc_CLSA_tra0$sdc_retire_0,useNA= "always")

table(sdc_CLSA_tra0$sdc_retire_0,CLSA_tra0$RET_RTRD_TRM, useNA= "always")
table(sdc_CLSA_tra0$sdc_employ_0,CLSA_tra0$RET_RTRD_TRM, useNA= "always")
table(sdc_CLSA_tra0$sdc_retire_0,sdc_CLSA_tra0$sdc_employ_0,useNA= "always")

table(CLSA_tra0$RET_RTRD_TRM)
table(CLSA_tra0$LBF_EVER_TRM)

```  
### **Variable label**: Retirement status   
**Variable name**: sdc_retire_1     
**Variable description**: Indicator of whether the participant is currently retired.    
**Value type**: integer    
**Variable unit**: N/A    
**Category coding**:  

**Code** | **Category Label**  
------------- | -------------  
0 | Currently not in retirement   
1 | Currently in retirement   

**Harmonization status**:  complete  
**Harmonization comment**:   Study-specific variable is categorized as: Completely retired | Partly retired | Not retired. Completely retired and partly retired people are coded as Currently in retirement. Participants who never held a paid job are coded as Currently not in retirement.    
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}

sdc_CLSA_tra1$sdc_retire_1<- ifelse(CLSA_tra1$RET_RTRD_TRF1==1|CLSA_tra1$RET_RTRD_TRF1==2, 1L, ifelse( CLSA_tra1$RET_RTRD_TRF1==3| CLSA_tra1$RET_RTRD_TRF1==4,0L,NA))

#Lots of NA values in the RTRD variable and the variable for returning back to employment after being retired has all empty values. 

table(sdc_CLSA_tra0$sdc_retire_0,useNA="always")
table(sdc_CLSA_tra1$sdc_retire_1,useNA="always")

#partly retired people are coded both as retired and as employed, if they also answered Yes to the question of Are you currently employed? (no such cases in baseline). People who never held a paid job are coded as 0 for both employment and retirement variable. 
table(sdc_CLSA_tra1$sdc_retire_1,sdc_CLSA_tra1$sdc_employ_1, useNA="always")
table(sdc_CLSA_tra0$sdc_retire_0,sdc_CLSA_tra0$sdc_employ_0, useNA="always")

```

### **Variable label**: Retirement age    
**Variable name**: sdc_retire_age_1    
**Variable description**: Age of the participant at retirement.  
**Value type**: integer    
**Variable unit**: years  
**Category coding**: N/A  

**Harmonization status**:  complete  
**Harmonization comment**:   The study specific variable asks "How old were you when you first retired/partly retired?"   
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}
MyMerge <- function(x,y){
  merge(x,y, by= c("id"),all=TRUE)
}
sdc_table <- Reduce(MyMerge, list(CLSA_tra0, CLSA_tra1))
#Harmonization scripts to create "ever had "

sdc_table$sdc_retire_age_0 <- sdc_table$RET_AGE_NB_TRM

table(CLSA_tra1$RET_AGE_NB_TRF1, useNA="always")



sdc_table$sdc_retire_age_1<-  ifelse(!is.na(sdc_table$RET_AGE_NB_TRF1),sdc_table$RET_AGE_NB_TRF1,sdc_table$sdc_retire_age_0)
#Based on cohort's response if current age is 4,5,6 years higher than the first retirement age, retire_age coded as NA

sdc_table$sdc_retire_age_1[sdc_table$AGE_NMBR_TRF1- sdc_table$RET_AGE_NB_TRF1<(-1)]<-NA
table(sdc_table$sdc_retire_age_1, useNA = "always")
sdc_CLSA_tra1<-merge(sdc_CLSA_tra1,sdc_table[,c("id","sdc_retire_age_1")],by="id",all.x=TRUE)


table(sdc_CLSA_tra1$sdc_retire_age_1, useNA="always")
```  

**Harmonization comment**:   The-study specific variables indicating the relationship of the individuals in the household to the participant, up till 9 individuals, are used to harmonize the DataSchema variable. Number of household members who were coded as children of the participant are summed.   
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}
CLSA_tra1$child1<-ifelse(CLSA_tra1$SN_LIVH_M2_R_TRF1=="05", 1L, NA)
CLSA_tra1$child2<-ifelse(CLSA_tra1$SN_LIVH_M3_R_TRF1=="05", 1L, NA)
CLSA_tra1$child3<-ifelse(CLSA_tra1$SN_LIVH_M4_R_TRF1=="05", 1L, NA)
CLSA_tra1$child4<-ifelse(CLSA_tra1$SN_LIVH_M5_R_TRF1=="05", 1L, NA)
CLSA_tra1$child5<-ifelse(CLSA_tra1$SN_LIVH_M6_R_TRF1=="05", 1L, NA)
```  
